docs.abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column on the forthcoming book and HBO documentary The Weight of the Nation, an ambitious multiplatform project that takes full measure of the girth of Americans; argues that the American obesity epidemic is the natural result of an overabundance of densely caloric food that has resulted from modern production techniques; notes that human beings are hard-wired to store fat whenever possible, and that overcoming those instincts will be a monumental battle.
docs.lead_paragraph: Is it flaw or fate that America has become so fat?
docs.snippet: Is it flaw or fate that America has become so fat?

headline.seo: Diabetes or Obesity in Pregnancy Tied to Developmental Delays
headline.print_headline: Hazards: Poor Health in Pregnancy Linked to Delays
headline.main: Hazards: Poor Health in Pregnancy Linked to Delays

docs.abstract: Dr Irva Hertz-Picciotto study in journal Pediatrics finds that a mother’s diabetes, hypertension or obesity during pregnancy may increase her child’s risk of autism and developmental problems.
docs.lead_paragraph: The individual contributions of hypertension, diabetes and obesity in mothers are not clear, but the increased risks to their children are more than double for developmental delays and more than 50 percent for autism, a study suggests.
docs.snippet: The individual contributions of hypertension, diabetes and obesity in mothers are not clear, but the increased risks to their children are more than double for developmental delays and more than 50 percent for autism, a study suggests.

headline.seo: Curtailed Sleep Raises Risk of Obesity and Diabetes
headline.print_headline: Risks: More Signs of Rest’s Regulatory Powers
headline.main: Risks: More Signs of Rest’s Regulatory Powers

docs.abstract: Orfeu M Buxton study in journal Science Translational Medicine finds further experimental evidence that inadequate sleep can increase the risk of obesity and diabetes.
docs.lead_paragraph: Volunteers in a study whose sleep patterns were shortened produced less insulin after eating, and higher glucose levels.
docs.snippet: Volunteers in a study whose sleep patterns were shortened produced less insulin after eating, and higher glucose levels.

headline.print_headline: Improving the State of America’s Teeth
headline.main: Improving the State of America’s Teeth

docs.abstract: Letter from William R Calnon, the president of the American Dental Assn, comments on the April 9 Louis W Sullivan Op-Ed article on ways to improve American dentistry.
docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to an Op-Ed article by Dr. Louis W. Sullivan, a former health and human services secretary.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to an Op-Ed article by Dr. Louis W. Sullivan, a former health and human services secretary.

headline.main: Do We Need More Advice About Eating Well?

docs.abstract: Maybe Americans would be healthier if we understood nutrition better. Or maybe we know enough, and eat poorly for other reasons.
docs.snippet: Maybe Americans would be healthier if we understood nutrition better. Or maybe we know enough, and eat poorly for other reasons.

docs.abstract: Academic field of food studies has arisen at colleges and universities in response to concerns over how food is produced and used and realization that food is critical to dozens of disciplines, from agriculture to business to international relations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Colleges and universities have come to realize that the classic food disciplines simply will not do anymore.
docs.snippet: Colleges and universities have come to realize that the classic food disciplines simply will not do anymore.

headline.seo: New Jersey/In the Region - The Art of Remaking Orange
headline.print_headline: The Art of Remaking a Downtown
headline.main: The Art of Remaking a Downtown

docs.abstract: Exhibit at the Museum of Modern Art in Manhattan envisions a new downtown Orange, NJ, as a campus-like pedestrian village. (In the Region/New Jersey)
docs.lead_paragraph: An exhibit at the Museum of Modern Art envisions a new downtown Orange as a campuslike pedestrian village.
docs.snippet: An exhibit at the Museum of Modern Art envisions a new downtown Orange as a campuslike pedestrian village.
